look at the more technical side of
things first the animation
well the animation for its time is
decent enough backgrounds are painted
with lush watercolors the lighting
effects are nice the movement for the
animals is realistic especially on the
red bull which seems to have extra
frames used for a smoother motion the
only bit I would say is a bit of a
letdown is the humans they seem to hold
a very simplistic facial expression
along with very limited movement other
than that though the animation is pretty
solid the music however has to be one of
the film's stronger aspects from the
epic choir scores that play at both the
beginning and the end to the intense
horror pieces we get such as when the
harpy is attacking but the highlight of
the music has to be the vocal tracks
that play throughout especially the main
title track apparently this track was so
popular that it was actually one of the
best-selling albums in Germany for 1983
so my final thoughts on the last unicorn
well it may not be a perfect film but it
is still a good watch the plot though
flawed still offers a lot of bold and
challenging ideas that you wouldn't get
to see in your typical kids film and
there are certain moments that do get
quite intense throughout I think I got
more out of this film during my second
watch as it allowed me to focus more on
what was currently happening on screen
between the characters love and then
trying to keep up with the plot the
animation is decent to look at and
definitely shines during the moments of
action the music is probably the
stronger aspect of the film both through
its epic instrumental scores and its
more wholesome vocal tracks most of
which will be seeking out to listen
again after I'd say give the last
unicorn a watch it's freely available on
YouTube for now
